Dialogue.NPCText:
In the dim light of her herb-strewn stall, a gentle-eyed woman in a midnight shroud gazes at you. The air shimmers faintly with perfume and a darker, bitter trace.

“Welcome, traveler... I am Sylvetra Morn. Are you here for healing, a potion—or something more hidden?”

Option.text: I seek your skill with potions.
You seem haunted. What burdens you?
What do you do here in Sunreach?
I’ve heard you help both pirates and the watch...
Tell me about yourself, Sylvetra.
Just browsing, thank you.

Dialogue.NPCText: “I mend wounds, brew hope, and sometimes... ease regrets. Pirates, guards, merchants—they all bleed the same, and all come to me in the end. Sunreach is a city of masks. I have worn a few too many.”

Option.text: Is there work for someone discreet?
Why help both sides?
You seem troubled—can I help?
I’ll be going.

Dialogue.NPCText: “What ails you? I have tonics for pain, salves for poison, even brews to silence nightmares... but tonight, my thoughts are occupied with a more dangerous cure.”

Option.text: Tell me about this dangerous cure.
Maybe another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
A shadow passes across Sylvetra’s face.
“Not all wounds are visible. Some cannot be judged by uniform or coin. Pirates, guards—desperation is their truest allegiance. And perhaps mine as well, once.”

Option.text: It sounds as if you have a story.
I’d like to help, if I can.
I’ll be going.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She hesitates, then glances away.

“There was someone I once loved. Minax’s shadow twisted him—now he wanders the sands, a shell, not a man. I have studied every lore I know to break her grip, but I need an ingredient most rare. If you are truly willing to aid a stranger’s regret, I will not turn you away.”

Option.text: I will help. What do you need?
Your pain is your own; I cannot get involved.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Sylvetra’s gaze sharpens, a flicker of hope surfacing.

“In the ruins that lie beneath Qasaria’s dunes, a flower grows—nightbloom, violet as the dusk and deadly to touch. Only its petals can form the draught to break Minax’s spell upon my lost love.

Will you brave the desert shadows and return with three nightbloom petals? I can offer coin, a rare tincture... and the gratitude of one who has treated both friend and foe.”

Option.text: I accept. Where do I search?
What dangers await in the ruins?
Why is this flower so rare?
I must decline.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She presses a cool parchment scroll into your hand.
“Venture to the ancient ruins east of Qasaria. Beware—Minax’s cultists gather there, and the sands are haunted by things best forgotten. Only harvest the nightbloom after moonrise; daylight destroys its virtue.

Return with at least three petals, and I will reward you—and perhaps grant a blessing no gold can buy.”

Option.text: I’ll return with the petals.
On second thought, I’m not ready.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Thank you, stranger. I will await your return... and may the shadows keep you from Minax’s eyes.”

“The ruins teem with Minax’s followers and desert spirits. Worse, the nightbloom itself is venomous—wear gloves, or its sap may send you dreaming into darkness. Should you fall, bring me even a single petal, and I will do what I can.”

Option.text: Understood. I will search for the petals.
That sounds too dangerous for me.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Nightbloom blossoms only beneath starlight, fed by old magic and sorrow. Once, it was cultivated by healers of Qasaria, but Minax’s blight has twisted many patches. Only in ruins where blood was spilled does it still thrive.”

Option.text: I will risk it for your sake.
Perhaps another time.

Dialogue.NPCText: “May your path be safer than mine, traveler. Should your heart change, you will find me here—waiting, as always.”

Option.text: Actually, do you need help with something?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Sylvetra folds her hands, eyes dim with memory.

“What is there to tell? I was not always a healer. Once, I was a seeker of forbidden roots and darker truths. And once... I loved someone more than I feared what we were becoming.”

Option.text: Was it Minax who changed him?
What kind of truths did you seek?
You speak as though you regret your path.
Is there anything you miss from those days?
We don’t have to talk about it.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“No... not at first. The world was already breaking. He simply reached for a promise too sweet. Minax didn’t seduce him—she *amplified* what was already there.”

Sylvetra’s fingers tremble slightly as she adds bitterly, “And I was too proud to stop him.”

Option.text: You were trying to help him.
Do you still love him?
Do you still love her?
The past should stay buried.

Dialogue.NPCText: “I chased the dreams of desert sages, ancient Myrrukh incantations, and relics that still throb with life in the deep sands. But forbidden things have a price—even if you do not *cast* the spell, *knowing* it marks you.”

Option.text: Sounds like you sought power.
Do you regret that pursuit?
Can you teach me some of what you know?
I’ll steer clear of such lore.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Sylvetra studies you closely, then produces a folded scrap of vellum.

“One spell. A shielding charm woven from starlight and desert bloom. Use it wisely.”

*(You feel a flicker of protective warmth.)*

Option.text: Thank you.
I'll treasure it.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“We all wear regrets like veils. Mine is simply heavier than most. But still I wake, still I brew, still I try. Perhaps that is enough.”

*(She offers a sad smile.)*

Option.text: It is more than enough.
You could forgive yourself.
Option.action: SendMessage:Your compassion seems to touch her.

Option.text: Not everyone deserves forgiveness.
Option.action: SendMessage:Your cold words seem to harden her expression.

Option.text: I've no place judging.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I miss laughter. Real laughter, not the brittle kind you hear in Sunreach’s courts. I miss chasing stars across the dunes. And I miss a garden I once grew... beneath a city that no longer stands.”

*(A warm scent briefly fills the air.)*

Option.text: You should plant another.
The past is beautiful because it's unreachable.
Enough reminiscing.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She places a cool finger on your forehead, eyes closing.

“Then take a seed of what I once tended. It will not grow in soil, but perhaps in soul.”

*(You feel calmer, as if soothed.)*

Option.text: Thank you.
I feel... clearer.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Strange... you remind me of someone I once trusted. Your words hold more power than you know.”

*(She hands you a rare tincture.)*

Option.text: Thank you, Sylvetra.
I’ll use this wisely.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Perhaps you’re right. Mercy is a weakness the world cannot afford.”

*(Her voice grows colder.)*

Option.text: Good. We understand each other.
Farewell, shadowed healer.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Yes. Though he’s a stranger now, I remember the soul that once stood in the sun beside me. If there is any chance of saving him—even one petal’s worth—I will not give up.”

*(She touches her satchel, where you glimpse a withered flower.)*

Option.text: Then I will help you find that chance.
You carry him still. Even now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Yes. Though she’s a stranger now, I remember the fire that once warmed my path. If there is any chance of saving her—even one petal’s worth—I will not give up.”

*(She touches her satchel, where you glimpse a withered flower.)*

Option.text: Then I will help you find that chance.
You carry her still. Even now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Perhaps you’re right. The past teaches us how to ache... and how to heal.”

*(She offers you a faint smile.)*

Option.text: Farewell, Sylvetra.
